intro: Eupatorium erythrolepis, commonly known as the red-leaved thoroughwort, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its striking red or purplish foliage and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other familiar flowering plants. Eupatorium erythrolepis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
